intro: Osbeckia annamica, commonly known as the Annam osbeckia, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Goodeniaceae and is characterized by its erect, herbaceous stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically pink or purple in color, arranged in clusters at the ends of the stems. Osbeckia annamica thrives in moist, shady environments and is often found in forest understories. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural studies.
